class_notes:
This foundation-level course exposes students to historical media and practices that undergird the physical creation of art objects in both two- and three-dimensional forms. Designed as a studio course to complement ARTHIST 101. Strategies and materials of art-making. Team-taught Class.
Hybrid class: students will be in two groups (A/B) meeting one day in class with additional work done asynchronously
course_description: This course explores historical media and art practices from Prehistory to the Renaissance. Students will study materials, techniques and practices of drawing, painting, print making, sculpture and architecture. Specific projects will be supplemented by readings, presentations and discussion.
